intro: Manihot esculenta var. pohlii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and edible tuberous roots. The plant is cultivated for its starchy roots, which are used as a thickening agent in cooking. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important crop in certain regions for both culinary and industrial uses.
